snippet: “Passing Stranger,” an audio tour, takes listeners through the history of the East Village’s interconnected writers and poets, with interviews, archival recordings and poetry recitations.
abstract: Danish writer Pejk Malinovski has created Passing Stranger, a site-specific audio tour that guides listeners through a history of the interconnected writers and cultural figures who have lived in the East Village; tour, which includes interviews, archival recordings and recitations of poems, is supported by the Poetry Foundation in Chicago and was nearly five years in the making.
lead_paragraph: “Passing Stranger,” an audio tour, takes listeners through the history of the East Village’s interconnected writers and poets, with interviews, archival recordings and poetry recitations.

headline.seo: In East Village, Audio Tour Retraces Poets’ Haunts
